meanings.definition: The religion or beliefs of heathens.
meanings.sent1: In heathendom, people worship different gods.
meanings.sent2: Heathendom was prevalent in ancient times.
meanings.sent3: The tourist was fascinated by the heathendom of the indigenous tribe.
meanings.sent4: To some, technology has become a new form of heathendom.
meanings.sent5: The heathendom of the Vikings included rituals to honor nature.

meanings.definition: The state of being a heathen.
meanings.sent1: She embraced heathendom after leaving her old faith.
meanings.sent2: His heathendom was met with curiosity by his peers.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics bordered on heathendom in the eyes of the dog.
meanings.sent4: In the land of academia, his unconventional ideas were seen as heathendom.
meanings.sent5: The heathendom of solitude brought him peace and introspection.

meanings.definition: The practices or customs of heathens.
meanings.sent1: The festival showcased the colorful heathendom of the tribe.
meanings.sent2: Exploring the ancient ruins revealed traces of heathendom.
meanings.sent3: The heathendom of wearing socks with sandals puzzled the fashion police.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling city, the street performers added a touch of heathendom to the atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The heathendom of feasting and dancing lasted long into the night.
